caption: Booked a tour with Get Your Guide. Tour guide was amazing. Took us inside quick and we're were all given lockers for our backpacks (which you're allowed to bring in) and coats. Great tour and amazing museum. Would take days to get through everything.

Highly recommend to book timed entry tickets in advance. Also have a plan in place and a list of must sees if you want to cover the museum in an organized way. We only had a couple of hours but we were able to make the most of it because we had a good plan. The museum is spectacular and magnanimous. Over 35000 exhibit display across 3 wings. We really enjoyed it a lot. It’s a must see in Paris. The Mona Lisa was stunning .

Make sure buy your tickets and that is well worth the price. It was €22 there’s some beautiful out there some of the best art in the world and I spent around three hours looking at all the art very well-maintained and the museum itself is just beautiful. We have different sculptures different. European paintings Islamic art Mesopotamian art. The Mona Lisa was good, but all the art itself in this museum is just very lovely to see as well. Will definitely be coming back one day. If you are in Paris, make sure to go you will not regret it. The Lisa area is very busy so keep that in mind as there are many people.

Excellent museum with state-of-the-art facilities and impressive architecture. It includes many departments and collections. I was impressed by the ancient Greek and Hellenistic period exhibits as well as Delacroix's paintings. At least 2 to 3 hours are required for a tour. Unfortunately the maps didn't help much and the heat was unbearable. I would like to admire those ancient Greek masterpieces in their place of origin and not in European museums. Ticket cost 22€.

Even if you think is boring, the museum is unique. Just walking around between the statues, jewellery, arts and rooms is very suggestive. The least interesting part (for me) could be the church-related stuff near the Gioconda, the rest worth to be seen even if you don’t know what you are looking at

Great attraction and a popular museum famous worldwide. Despite visiting Paris on three separate occasions, I am yet to visit the museum itself due to the waiting crowds! The Louvre and the area surrounding it is rich with great architecture and creative structures. There is still a lot to be enjoyed even if you are unable to visit the museum itself. It is located right in the middle of Paris near famous parks and places in the city. If you do not have the opportunity to visit Paris more than once in your lifetime, I would recommend that you visit the museum and its surrounding areas when in this beautiful city.
The audio while hard to understand at first, was very useful and told us a lot about the museum. Of course the Mona Lisa was great! But less busy than I though so that was pretty good

It is such a spectacular museum! I highly recommend getting tickets in advance because otherwise the lines are extremely long! The Louvre really lives up to the expectation! It’s also HUGE! So prepare to spend the entire day there! A must see stop on a Paris trip!!

A very, very big and breathtaking museum. Do not underestimate the size and wonder of this museum.  A lot of people were at the Mona Lisa, of course, but there are many, many more pieces of art to admire. It's free for under 18s which I find very neat!

If you’re coming to Paris, you have to make it a point to visit the louvre. It’s breathtaking, the architecture and history; would want you to spend your whole day here just admiring and enjoying your peaceful time. Don’t be like me and not book tickets in advance, highly recommend to do it online and not on its because of the super long queues to avoid over crowding

It's the Louvre, what is there really to say?  Lot's of beautiful works of art. Couple of things to be prepared for:  1. This is one of the most popular museums in the world. There will be lines, there will be tons of people. I went on a cold and rainy day and it was still busy.  2. The museum layout is a little confusing. The maps you can take with you eliminate a lot of rooms, so get a feel for how the room numbers work so you can always figure out which way to go.  3. Everyone wants to see the Mona Lisa. It's chaos on that floor. Be ready for a very thick crowd all trying to get a picture of the famous painting.  4. Use the coat check. It's free. You aren't going to want to carry your coats around.

Although we came first and waited in line (with reserve), security didn't let us in. Despite it being written nowhere, those who came as a group were let in before us. At 9:45 a.m., we were able to get in with a fight. And you know the museum's collection is good.

By the time we reached here it was closed for the day so we could see only the exterior and it was very beautiful. The glass pyramid, statues, huge compound with lovely fountains are worth seeing. One hour is sufficient for exterior but for inside we were told minimum half a day is required. Mya be next time...

The greatest museum humanity has to offer.  I thought the hermitage museum is Russia was the best the world had. I was so wrong.  We got our timed tickets for 9am, and waited in the secret underground line to avoid the cold weather. You go under an escalator and line up underneath the reverse pyramid. You can google it for a guide!  We were there at 8 with only a couple people ahead of us, and saw the Mona Lisa in a near empty room.  With that out of the way we spent 4h and 40,000 steps walking around and precariously standing near tour guides. I wish we paid for a guide ourselves!  The marble sculptures were what I went for, and it was jaw dropping. Eat before or after though.

Amazing, a lot of unique and pretty things  Super big (if you want to see everything you need the whole day, (I just stay there for 3hrs and I see the most famous things)  Inside are free lockers to leave your stuff and have 6 cafeterias

Absolutely massive museum, so expansive, this cannot be done in one day.  Visitors on a time schedule will have to decide which exhibits are most important to them and navigate through the labyrinth of the building to see what they want.  I cannot calculate the time it would take to see and take in all the exhibits, unfathomable.  Museum staff are doing an excellent job guarding their museumjob guarding

One of my favourite museum in Europe; amazing collection so vast that even after 3 visits I feel like I haven’t seen it all. Now with the new Louvre Carousel there it’s even more nice experience to visit it.
Incredible museum, one of the best in the world. 4 stars because they do not manage the pickpockets in front of Mona Lisa (be careful, a pre-teen girl tried to open my bag).

This place is THE number 1 museum in the world. The place is huge. The sculptures are amazing. The Paintings induce you into amazement. The Coronation of the Virgin Tintoretto, 1580, although lesser know than Divinci's Mona Lisa, it is important look. There is an Islamic section that is out there for obvious reasons,  I do still appreciate the items. It felt very difficult to try to see the whole museum in half a day and you will walk a very far distance. Definitely use shoes you can walk in. I was not able to find a route that I could optimize the route through the museum. The high up levels were not open at the time. The online map can be useful. There are very valuable Egyptian artifacts.

Make sure you wear comfortable clothes and shoes as museum is really huge and worthy to explore fully ( at least for 2-3 hours).  You can buy audio guide or just read the information in English. Do not have high hopes to see Mona Lisa closely - it’s always crowded there.  Overall, an amazing experience!

The Louvre Museum is an incredible experience with breathtaking art and history. It’s a must-visit in Paris, and I thoroughly enjoyed my time there. However, I wish some of the signs were written in English as well, considering it’s such a major tourist attraction. It would make the experience even better for international visitors. Overall, a great visit!

My visit to the Louvre Museum in Paris was very nice. The museum itself is a masterpiece, both in terms of its architecture and the vast collection of art. The entry might take time due to long line so better book your tickets online.  One of the most memorable moments was finally seeing the Mona Lisa. The painting’s aura was next level. Surrounded by crowds, it still managed to stand out as a symbol of artistic brilliance. Watching it up close, I could appreciate the mysterious expression and delicate brushstrokes that have intrigued art lovers for centuries.  Another highlight of my visit was the stunning collection of royal ornaments. The intricate craftsmanship of the crowns, scepters, and jewels was dazzling.  The Louvre’s collection is vast, and it’s impossible to see everything in one visit. However, my experience was unforgettable, filled with iconic art, rich history, and a deep appreciation for the masterpieces housed there. For anyone visiting Paris, the Louvre is an absolute must-see!
You cannot have enough of this place. Beautiful inside out. Full of marvels. Needs multiple days to see and appreciate the masterpieces the Louvre holds. But tickets online in advance.
Very beautiful museum, the best we ever visited.  We bought the fast pass ticket and it’s worth.. you can get through the long queue and walk straight to the Monalisa.

If you have the opportunity to kill a few hours, get a ticket or bring your family / loved ones for a few hours and see memorable pieces from around the world.  My kids will always cherish and know some of the art displayed, at this museum.

Finally went on my 4/5th trip to Paris! Place is massive so if you really into art you would need to come back here again because it’s so extensive. There was a massive crowd near the Mona Lisa naturally, but it’s worth the weight.

Massive place with lots of sections. You need to choose what to see to enjoy leisurely your visit. You definitely need a whole day to explore everything.  Lots of galleries have toilet stock and some toilets do not have soap- it is a shame.

super magical place! if you are incredibly into art, seeing it all would probably take several days. if you’re moderately into art, a few hours here will do. perfect to visit during a rainy or cold day in paris :) there are signs everywhere to help you get around and the staff is pretty helpful too. there seems to always be a line to see the monalisa and it is a little underwhelming to see it with a massive crowd around it but still very much worth it!

If you love art or are curious about art and history, you HAVE to visit the Louvre. I’ve been to the Louvre 3 times on a visit, and 2 out of 3 have been great because I booked a small private tour. It’s always going to be crowded, a private tour eases the process and makes it so much better.  You have to buy tickets in advance!

It’s the most worthwhile museum to visit in Paris, open until 9 p.m. on Wednesdays and Fridays. You can’t pay directly on the official website, so tickets have to be bought through online agents, and if you try to book a week in advance, only entry slots after 12 p.m. are available. Visiting for eight hours means covering over ten kilometers on foot, but it’s absolutely worth it—this museum has the richest collection of art in the world!

What a beauty it is. One of the best. Seems like a shopping mall worlds best antique but you cannot buy anything. So big , so grand and so beautiful. One of its kind. You have to wait a lot in queue. Don’t buy ticket in advance buy only standing in the queue at museum. Buy tickets only from official website. It’s so difficult to cover everything in a single day.

This is without a doubt the best museum I've ever been to. I can't express how amazing it is. Floor to ceiling, wall to wall, absolutely packed to the brim with the finest art you'll ever have the privilege to see. I was overwhelmed by the size and magnitude of this place.  Do yourself a favor by grabbing a map and don't be in a hurry. You could easily spend all day inside. And definitely wear comfy shoes! There's tons of ground to cover and lots of stairs.  Buy tickets in advance!  We bought tickets for 10am entry and the crowds weren't too bad. By the time we left, around 2pm, the place was packed. O.o

Stunning art work and pieces. Nice to get in free as eu resident under 26. Definitely better to book at least a week in advance and for earliest time slot available because there will be a long line for security and entrance that gets longer by the minute. Don’t just go for the famous paintings. Take the time to soak in the beauty of every inch or every room.

Loved it! The emplacement, the art, the easy to get in and around, the order inside, the cleanness. It s a very crowded place even on Weekdays. I would recommend comfortable shoes, buying your tickets ahead of time and coming without packages or big bags so you can enjoy your visit with comfort. It is a beautiful structure and walking around the patio or plaza around it observing both buildings the old and new and modern it’s enjoyable. Just to sit around on a cafe it’s submerging yourself on any French tale or movie.

A worth visiting key place in Paris, definitely not Worthing spending the whole day there, just go to the main artworks, especially if you don’t have a lot of time in Paris (as I did). Definitely book tickets in advance, but the line is moving really fast!! FREE FOR EU STUDENTS
Absolutely loved the beautiful and iconic architecture. The art and cultural experience was equally spectacular. Recommend popping by at night for a nicer view of the Louvre Museum!

Wow.  What a museum.  We honestly saw all the art we wanted to in 3 hours.  Went late on the day on Friday (open late). Smaller crowds. *** mummy section closed on Friday — that did cut our trip short.   Be sure to get to the lower levels and walk what was the mote when the museum was originally a fort.

The wait to get in is long, then you must wait again to be processed and security checked. The museum is very large and it's impossible to be seen in one visit in my opinion. It is best to prioritize the exhibition that you wish to see. The Mona Lisa is very popular and unfortunately people do not move away from the front after they have been there for a while, to give others an opportunity to look up close.
